content.description: Huecos to the top!  Start with both hands in opposing huecos, bump your left up as you go and top it out, slope style.
content.location: Middle of Campfire Rock, obvious huecos

content.description: Start with a ringlock/jam in the crack on the backside of the boulder.  Use a series of toe hooks, heel hooks, and bicycles to work your way under the roof traverse.  Pop out on the other side onto a good ledge and use crimps to gain access to the slopey topout.
content.location: Under the obvious roof of Campfire Rock

content.description: Use a series of crimps and small feet to traverse the face and finish on the large horn.  The name is given to the rock which constantly disintegrates with each try.  Not too many ascents left.
content.location: Cow Pies boulder, to the right of Cow Pies Direct.  Also to the right of the large time warp bubble which will allegedly direct you back to The Jungle.

content.description: Begin matched on the big block.  Stay balanced and use the intermediate crimp to gain access to the arete.  Finish as cow pies direct, with a desperate throw to the top.
content.location: Cow Pies Boulder, to the right of Cow Pies direct

content.description: Begin matched on a rail under the small roof and a foot that is just above ground level on the arete.  Use toe hooks to get out to the arete and finish with a desperate topout.
content.location: On the Cow Pies Boulder, under the small roof.  This boulder is located just before you reach The Shocker problem, almost kittycorner you could say

content.description: A flake or two, a crack, and some deep pockets gets you to the top
content.protection: A pad and a realistic fear of sandstone?
content.location: Just left of the spur road or entrance road near an old campfire

content.description: Begin in an undercling and work your way up the arete to a final slap finish on top
content.location: Near the end of the Main Area.  You will see it on your left when walking away from the Campfire Rock
